description:
The metadata service (at http://169.254.169.254) can now be reached from the instance, however querying for specific keys fails:
wget http://169.254.169.254/2009-04-04/meta-data/instance-id
returns HTTP Error 500
title: Metadata service queries fail

comments.content:
The metadata service (at http://169.254.169.254) can now be reached from the instance, however querying for specific keys fails:
wget http://169.254.169.254/2009-04-04/meta-data/instance-id
returns HTTP Error 500
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content:
Looking into nova-api logs, it appears that the failure is at:

  File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/nova/api/ec2/cloud.py", line 158, in get_metadata
    'user-data': base64.b64decode(instance_ref['user_data']),
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/base64.py", line 73, in b64decode
    return binascii.a2b_base64(s)
TypeError: a2b_base64() argument 1 must be string or read-only character buffer, not None

instance_ref['user_data'] is None (the user_data field in the instances table being empty).

I tried passing --user-data in the euca-run-instances call to work around it, but it appears that the
user_data field is never set ?

Adding some valid base64 content into that column in /var/lib/nova/nova.sqlite makes the metadata service return correctly.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx
